result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Richard Cadwallader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court waives fine and orders costs of $243.00.
DNA surcharge waived.
Defendant to meet with the payment clerk.
Court grants expungement in 1 year if the Defendant has not committed any new crimes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Richard Cadwallader

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From DE on 10-05-15 stating he has Q's about his Pplan.  Attempted to return call to DE, but did not leave a msg as the v/m did not appear to be his own.  DE called back today & was advised his next pymt is not technically due til April of 2016, but was encouraged to get the bal pd off as quickly as possible.  DE stated he will more & likely pay the bal of $113 off next mo. jaf
DE called to request ext for late Sept pymt.  DE approved to make pymt by 4:30pm on 9-15-15. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $20/mo comm 9-01-15.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Nicholas Richard Cadwallader appeared.  Court called at 9:19 a.m. Set for Motion Hearing.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Quesionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Court enters a Guilty Plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.   Sentencing arguments. Court questions the DE.  Crt orders:

DE sentenced to 1 day in the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 1 day time served
- Court grants expungement in 1 year if the DE has not committed any new crimes
- Court waives the fine and court orders costs of $243.00 and no DNA surcharge
- Court grants payment plan and DE to meet with the payment clerk
- 20 days to appeal
from Defendant stating he is running about 10 minutes late but will be here. eif
from Defendant asking to reschedule 7/8/15 MH because he is out of town. eif
Motion hearing on July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Nicholas Richard Cadwallader appeared.  Court called at 9:34 a.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court there is not a resolution at this time.  Attorney Andrea is filing a Motion to Suppress.  Set out for Motion Hearing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:37 a.m. lw  Motion hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF:  Nicholas Richard Cadwallader did not appear. Defendant was unable to appear today due to participation in treatment. Court resets. Clerk to mail notice at the last known address.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Def called stating he has been unable to reach his Atty and he is in treatment 4 days per week and unable to appear this morning. Def was concerned that a warrant would be issued for his arrest.  Def plans to fax a letter to EJL requesting that today's PTC be rescheduled. mw
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes for McKinley, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF:  Nicholas Robert Cadwallader appeared. His middle name is "Richard".  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:15 am.
